Articles.Content:
Lately, with all the new releases and pre-releases for Minecraft, I\'ve been reluctant to play. Why? Notch has added things that don\'t work and/are annoying. For example,

-Endermen can pick up ANY block, including bedrock and player-placed. They also have zombie sounds as a placeholder.

-Hunger Bar: Me and my friend agree that it\'s one of the worst things to happen to Minecraft. Adds to the whole maintenance aspect that we hate. Food stacks, which helps, but does not make up for it.

-Animal persistence. Now that breeding has been implemented, it helps a small bit, but may God have mercy if you are n00b who doesn\'t know yet.

-Leather is nearly impossible to get now. Iron ore has been buffed, so now it\'s very likely that you will have iron armor before leather.

-As of the 1.8.1 update, no snow will fall in tundra biomes. That\'s one of the worst right there -- I love the snow, but Notch removed it to show off the new swamp biomes.

/endrant

A lot of people will disagree with me on all this, and that\'s okay -- just keep it civil. I just hope that Notch gives a huge checklist of things we can toggle on/off, to tailor our game to our liking.

Most of what you mention are bugs, not features.

bugs that are fixed in 1.9

Honestly i\'m of the opposite opinion, if people weren\'t whining for a new update as much maybe he wouldn\'t need to release them with half finished features (yes that\'s probably a reality of making a commercial game of course)

That is all very true. I was just reading the wiki, and there are four new mobs, multiple new items (half of which are mob-specific and don\'t have a use yet), and bugfixes. I\'m also starting to think that it\'s becoming complicated to learn about all the features of Minecraft, and a very steep learning curve to go with it.

I think it would be better for Notch to focus on one thing at a time until it\'s finished, like what HarvestR\'s doing with KSP.
i think the people asked notch way to much for 1.8 and he rushed it and now there\'s all the bugs,performance issues and so much more but again that\'s what i think
I like the changes to the food, I like that the enderman can actually effect the environment in a way other than simply exploding.
That\'s what you get for being suckered in to buying an unfinished game

I wasn\'t suckered into it, I consciously chose to buy it. However, this was back when there were relatively few bugs. Now, the amount of annoying things has hit a level that I can\'t stand.

Even if it is under development, I think that the developer should look to the community for feedback on what\'s fun, and what\'s not. I think that Notch has partially lost sight of that.
Notch is just in it for the money. He\'ll only keep consumer satisfaction up high enough to ensure that people will still buy it.
